        right(75);
        forward(100);
        repeat(n)
        {
                left(180-(210-(180.0-(360.0/n))));
                forward(100);
                right(150);
                forward(100);
        }
        getClick();
}

08/08/2024, 18:46 - +91 63807 72024: Dear all,

Student vaccination for new UG student is scheduled on 10th & 11th
August 2024 from 9.30 am to 5.00 pm in IITB hospital, New wing.

following are the google form links for registration (Registration is
mandatory)

For 10th August 2024

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeNxK7XKATPfVHIsY4oqzUG6FXk2jTV5xT42d-57eOErxr0IA/viewform?usp=sf_link

For 11th August 2024

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScEsKOFEWwNeBV8-FZ0FRpen8XEpAfPUT6HV3tLkt0xZ7xaiQ/viewform?usp=sf_link

The registration for 400 students will be done on first cum first
basis/day.

VACCINATION INFORMATION

Name of Vaccines

Date of administration of Vaccine

1) MMR (One booster is recommended after 15 yrs. of age)  :

2) Chicken Pox                    :

3) Typhoid                           :

4) Hepatitis 'A'                    :¬≠

These vaccines are highly recommended as there is high incidence of
these diseases resulting into high morbidity and loss of Student working
days.

From the past experience the vaccination has been found necessary for
student. Still many students are  hesitant to take vaccine

Kindly note as informed earlier that making medical folder is mandatory
for all students.

There will be no medical certificate ( pink slip) or medical
reimbursement without medical folder


Instructions for the students:

1. Report to hospital (new wing - ground floor)

2. Please bring your immunization/ vaccination record for verification.

3. Bring printout of your Student Medical form with attached photo.

4. Students are specifically instructed to have healthy breakfast/ lunch
    and hydrate themselves well before coming to the vaccination (carry
some
    biscuits/fruits and water bottle)

5. Students suffering from cold, cough, fever/on medication in past 7
days may refrain form vaccination now.

--
Regards,

If you wish to take a vaccine from IIT Bombay hospital, Please use the
link to pay first. This link is available at "External ASC > payments
tab". You can show the successful payment when you go to the
hospital.This is only administration charges.

The cost of vaccine is separate and has to be paid to the pharmacy when
you visit for vaccination. The following are the charges of Vaccines
available at IITB hospital Pharmacy.

1.  M.M.R vaccine - Rs. 388/-
2. Chickenpox vaccine - Rs. 1522/-
3. Typhoid vaccine - Rs. 1384/-
4. Hepatitis A vaccine - Rs.1240/-

5-day Sanskrit sambhashan Shiviram

*Date*:- From 14th August to 18th August 2024.

*Time*:- 21:00Hrs to 22:30Hrs.


 Central Sanskrit University in collaboration with IIT Bombay 

*Venue*:  LC101 IIT Bombay 

‚ñ™Ô∏èLearn Hassle-free
‚ñ™Ô∏èNo Fees. It's free.
‚ñ™Ô∏èNo age barrier. Children less than the age of 10 to be accompanied by an adult family member. (For children less than 16 years we will have a separate program later).
‚ñ™Ô∏è No prior Sanskrit knowledge needed.
‚ñ™Ô∏èLearn words & sentences spoken in daily life. 
‚ñ™Ô∏èNo stress on cramming up complex grammar.
‚ñ™Ô∏èMode of teaching is by conversation. No need to make notes. 
- Come and go hands-free... Tension-free learning. 

For registration, please fill this form: https://forms.gle/CANR682tT6iPfnQP7

28/08/2024, 18:48 - +91 90215 88219: If a function is differentiable on a closed interval [ab] then even if it's derivative function may or may not be continuous, it always has the intermediate value property ie for every k ST f'a<k<f'b (assume wlg f'a<f'b the other way also works) there exists c belonging to (ab) ST f'c=k

The Indian Languages Club of IIT Bombay promotes and conserves the Indian Languages through various literary genres such as storytelling, writing, poetry, word games, movie nights etc. The club conducts many activities, workshops and events for the same.

Vaani in collaboration with Institute Cultural Council Presents "AAGHAZ", Open Mic! Join us this Friday, 30th August at 6:30 PM, at Theatre Room , Old SAC and be part of our lovely Family!

An Open Mic is being organised in AAGHAZ. Get a chance to perform in front of your Seniors and Batchmates for the first time! You can perform any original or someone else's piece in any Indian Language.

Exciting prizes and refreshments waiting for you, what are you waiting for? Let's begin your journey with Vaani.

Democracy ‚úÖ
29/08/2024, 20:20 - +91 90477 97333: assumption: f'' is non zero in (a,b).
let r ‚àà (a,b), then by MVT: f''(r) = (f'(b)-f'(a))/(b-a) 
the above line concludes that f'(b)-f'(a) is non zero.
lets create a new function g(x) with the help of increment function
g(x) = f(x) - (f(b)-f(a))/(f'(b)-f'(a)) * f'(x)
now note that g(x) is continuous and g(b) = g(a), by MVT we have:
‚àÉ  c ‚àà (a,b): g'(c) = 0 = f'(c) - (f(b)-f(a))/(f'(b)-f'(a)) * f''(c)
rearranging we get: f'(c)[f'(b)-f'(a)] = f''(c)[f(b)-f(a)], QED.

ps: without the assumption, LHS = RHS = 0 :)

08/10/2024, 16:30 - +91 80186 61497: Dear all,

We have noticed that students leave taps open after use, leading to water loss overnight. BMC supplies water to the IIT campus from the major lakes of Greater Mumbai, whose levels are continually declining due to scanty rainfall because of climate change. Sometimes, students leave the tap open because the old taps have become too tight to close.

I am floating this form to collect the list of all faulty taps/leaky pipelines/toilet flushes, etc. in Hostel 1:

https://forms.office.com/r/tSSEEdAsPt

The form will be open till Sunday (13.10.2024). Please take some time to fill this form for a greener planet.

Also, please ensure that you don't leave the taps open after use.

Additionally,

1. Switch OFF lights/fans when NOT in use.

2. Use a clothesline for drying clothes instead of dryer. Use dryer ONLY during rains.

3. Don't take excess food and throw it in the waste bin. Take what you can eat, and eat what you can take!

Thank You

Sincerely,

10/11/2024, 20:19 - +91 95101 90597: section .data
    message db "What is in dinner today", 0    ; Define the string with a null terminator

section .text
    global _start

_start:
    ; sys_write call to print the message
    mov eax, 4              ; System call number for sys_write (4)
    mov ebx, 1              ; File descriptor 1 (standard output)
    mov ecx, message        ; Address of the message
    mov edx, 22             ; Length of the message
    int 0x80                ; Interrupt to make the system call

    ; sys_exit call to end the program
    mov eax, 1              ; System call number for sys_exit (1)
    xor ebx, ebx            ; Exit code 0
    int 0x80                ; Interrupt to make the system call

In any institution, its leaders play a pivotal role in shaping its
character and future. The Student Council, in this context, stands as
the backbone of any hostel. Their responsibilities extend beyond daily
operations to resolving the concerns of students and ensuring that the
hostel remains a place of harmony, growth, and excellence. We are now
planning to identify a fresh council based only on first year UG
residents of H1, while outgoing council shall help us in smooth
transition to the new council. I request each of you to consider being
part of the Hostel 1 council, bringing your vision, passion, and
leadership qualities to the forefront.

Mess Secys            - 4
  * Maintenance Secys - 3
  * Cultural Secys        - 3
  * Sports Secys          - 4
  * Technical Secys      - 3
  * Garden Secys        - 2

To acquaint yourself with the specific roles and responsibilities
associated with each position, I recommend going through the attached
document. The nomination form is also attached and interested hostel
residents are informed to kindly fill the Nomination Form. The
nomination form attached with this email need to be uploaded in Google
form as PDF format.

Link of Google Form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLdh6Mgi7P_1R3nE0varwMldyuhMgvtqsU5_UFD5tCXXaz0g/viewform?usp=sharing

The above positions will be decided based on the following procedure.

  * personal interaction with each person after the screening of Google
response
  * If there is any clash then open a session in the presence of hostel
inmates.
  * The final decision will be taken by a a panel of Warden H1, Asso
Warden H1 and Warden H16

Selection time Track:

  * Nomination: Interested candidates can file their nominations by
Monday, 15-12-2024, 11:59 p.m.
  * Interactions with potential candidates in the second week of January
2025.

taken by new council within two days after declaration of results

23/12/2024, 17:47 - +91 63807 72024: Dear Students,
Introduction to HASMED (Humanities, Arts, Social-Science, Management, Entrepreneurship, and Design) is a basket of courses. Registration for HASMED courses is being done through a pre-registration process. The window of pre-registration for HASMED courses will be opened from 23/12/2024 (Monday) and closed on 26/12/2024 (Thursday) at 1.00 pm.

To fill the HASMED pre-registration form, students are required to login to portal.iitb.ac.in/asc and go to Forms/Requests. Students can credit any two courses from the basket by giving an order of preference for the courses they wish to study. The allocation is not entirely based on the first and second choices of the students. Owing to the limited number of seats available for each course, students will be allotted the courses randomly (independent of the branch or AIR), but keeping in mind their order of preference. Students will be notified about the courses allotted to them on their registration portal.

Make sure to submit all possible choices of HASMED courses during pre-registration.

22/01/2025, 15:44 - Mayank Jain (S1): Dear first-year students,

The second semester has started, bringing with it various new activities, projects, and experiences that the institute has to offer. One of these experiences is Gymkhana Elections, conducted in a yearly manner to elect student representatives in various student bodies of SAC. Your ISMP mentors may have talked to you about this.

As students of this institute, it is your right to participate and vote in these elections in a free manner. However, often first-year students receive (and believe) misleading rumours and wrong information from senior students involved in unofficial campaigning. We wish to clarify some of these issues to ensure you are better informed.

1. Before voting, ensure you are well informed about the candidates by going through their manifesto, asking them questions when they visit and attending the soapbox to make an informed choice. You must make an INDEPENDENT decision, which can be different from your friends or seniors. You are also free to not vote for any candidate.

2. In NO WAY should you feel forced to vote for a particular candidate. Cases have been reported of PoRs and internship/placement advantages being offered to freshers - such promises/threats are false, lacking credibility. A single person/senior does not influence your future PoRs/career at IIT Bombay; all these activities are STRICTLY meritocratic at IIT Bombay.. In case you feel being influenced/pressured like this, talk to your ISMP mentors and they will escalate it to the relevant authorities.

3. You have an independent choice of supporting whichever candidate, however some things are strictly off the table and punishable by an Election DAC (Disciplinary Action) from the Dean SA Office. Examples include campaigning in the final two election days, forcing someone to cast a particular vote etc. These DACs have repercussions ranging from permanent PoR disqualification, to being marked on your transcript.

4. Your mentor will help you be informed about elections, and you may or may not choose to support the same candidate as your mentor (if they are supporting any). However, your mentors are NOT allowed to influence your vote, or ask you to campaign. If you feel you are being influenced/pressured by your mentor, feel free to contact us via mail.

Multiple senior students will reach out to you during this phase, and you must differentiate between wrong influences and those having your best interest in mind. We encourage you to read more about the elections in mails sent by the Dean of Student Affairs and the Election Commission, and reach out to your ISMP mentors to gain more information.

invite you to share specific concerns or suggestions related to:

  * Common Areas - Cleanliness of corridors, staircases, and lounges.
  * Amenities Rooms- Cleanliness in the Gym, Yoga, TT, Study, Music and
Cultural Activity Room
  * Restrooms & Wash Areas - Maintenance, sanitation, and supply of
essentials.

and utensil hygiene.
  * Waste Management - Availability and proper use of dustbins,
recycling practices, and waste segregation.
  * Room Maintenance - Frequency of cleaning services and general
upkeep.

Google form [1].

cleaning frequency, improving waste disposal, and ensuring better
sanitization measures.

you have to sign in with pplx.ai/students else the token for the Pro won't be assigned to your email

5. if step 4 didn't work, delete your account and do step 1-3

10/02/2025, 01:47 - Siddhant Joshi: Dear Hostelmates,

Let's take a moment to appreciate the sheer dedication of your dear
seniors/mentors/peers (if involved), who suddenly turn into event
organizers, party hosts, and your new best friends right before the
elections. Who knew that a pizza slice or a cup of chai could be a
substitute for genuine leadership?

But here's the deal--your vote isn't a coupon that gets redeemed for
food or flattery. It reflects your values, judgment, and the kind of
leadership you want. If a plate of snacks is all it takes to sway your
decision, well, congratulations! You've just placed your self-worth at
the price of a Margherita. üçï

In any case, I would like to remind you that hostel premises are NOT for
organizing campaign events, including these "hospitality stunts." Any
such unauthorized gathering is strictly prohibited. Moreover, a hefty
penalty will be imposed if anyone is found damaging Hostel H1 property.
So, let's not turn our hostel into a place of freebie politics.

Most importantly, your vote is yours alone. You have the full right to
decide without any pressure. If anyone tries to coerce or intimidate
you, please report it immediately to the hostel office or the election
commission. You don't need to entertain anyone trying to influence your
decision. Your voice matters, and it should never be overshadowed by
manipulation.

Choose wisely. Stay smart. Remained focused on what matters most.

--

Best Regards

Akhilesh Panwar

16/02/2025, 01:02 - Siddhant Joshi: They don't do anything on Sunday
16/02/2025, 09:13 - Siddhant Joshi: Dear Students,  

Today is the day of the Gymkhana Elections, which you all have been waiting for. It is the culmination of the hard work and efforts of all the candidates during this election season.

Polling will be done in online mode through SSO login and can be accessed through the IITB network (to access from outside use a VPN, see: https://www.cc.iitb.ac.in/page/configurevpn)
In case of some trouble accessing the portal try using incognito mode.

All the interhostel and opposite genders entries are strictly prohibited and banned on account of the election day.


TIME FOR VOTING: 10 AM to 8 PM
Election portal link: https://gymkhanaelection25.iitb.ac.in/

A few general points regarding this (already circulated):

#1. Campaigning of any form is strictly prohibited.
#2. Please keep your Institute ID cards on your person at all times. You may be asked to show these for random checks. Please cooperate with the security personnel, Election Officers, or EC members if you are asked to do so.
#3. Entry of non-hostel residents (Ex. entry of a student of Hostel X in another Hostel Y) is strictly prohibited on the account of election day. Please do not argue with the Security personnel or EC members in case you are asked to leave.
#4. Individuals who have been blacklisted are not allowed to leave their rooms without prior permission from EC.
#5. Election officers are not supposed to suggest any names to you or influence you in any way. They are volunteering only to assist in the process. In case you find any Election Officer (or any person in general) trying to influence the way you vote, please report this to elections@iitb.ac.in. Strict actions will be taken against those who try to unduly influence the polling process.
#6. PLEASE VOTE ACCORDING TO YOUR CHOICE.
#7. Note that NO ONE is allowed to peek at your screen when you are voting (apart from the ones helping the visually challenged).
#8. Please note that entry at the main gate is strictly being monitored. Candidates, if seen by Election Officers inside campus, shall be moved to SAC. The voting procedure for the candidates will be informed to them personally.
#9. Blacklisted students are not permitted to leave their rooms. If found roaming around, they will be moved to SAC. The list of these students is already circulated. 
#10.Closure of the SAC facilities on the account of election day.
The rules of polling are as follows:
1. For multiple candidates for a post, you have the option of
a. Choosing a candidate
b. None of the above (NOTA) implies you do not wish any of the candidates to be elected.
c. Neutral means you do not wish to vote for the particular election
The candidate with the highest number of votes is elected, provided his total votes also exceed NOTA (Neutral votes are excluded)

2. For posts where only one candidate is contesting, the voter would be able to choose from the following:
a. Yes, implying you wish the candidate to be chosen
b. No implying you do not wish the candidate to be chosen
c. Neutral, implying you do not wish to cast your vote for the post
The candidate would be elected if the number of Yes's are greater than the number of No's (Neutral votes are excluded).

Those who have not yet received their autumn SMA refund amount can check
the reason on notice board placed opp. office.

There are 3 main reasons

1. Non availability of Bank Details with office

report the same, your amount/dues will be carried forwarded to spring
semester.

26/02/2025, 14:08 - Pranjal Uniyal(S1): Dear All,
 
It is intimated that Leopard sightings have been reported in the campus in the past few days near SBI water channel and White House in lake side area. All are advised to be very cautious and alert, and generally avoid moving in deserted areas, especially after it gets dark. It has been noticed that few students and IIT Bombay employees/ their dependents have been found to be frequenting these sites / places, like  Boat House, SAMEER Hill Top etc.
 
It is once again intimated to all, to be vigilant and not to visit any deserted/ isolated area on campus. 
 
In case of any emergency, security may be contacted on the following numbers:-
 
Main Gate Control- 1100/1122/1123/1112 (intercom numbers)
QRT-           9833338989
Duty Officer-  9167398596
Duty Inspector-9167398597
 
The Do's and Don'ts about the subject is available respectively in the link below:

https://bighome.iitb.ac.in/index.php/s/eiJJ2MYf4NKsAZg
 
 
Please stay safe and cooperate for better service. 
 
--

Indian Institute of Technology Bombay

This is with reference to the formation of hostel council exercise that we
undertook to form a new council from UG students of H1. We received a good
response from the students with expressions of interest received from 70
students.  It was certainly a difficult task for the panel (H16 Warden, H1
Associate warden and H1 Warden) to identify the final list of the
candidates for the council as every student candidate has a great track
record and interest to serve in the council. Therefore, the final list was
arrived at considering various factors including EoI documents, relevant
experience and in person interaction of the shortlisted candidates, and
accordingly the below given list of council has been identified to run the
hostel council. However, please note that this list is subject to approval
from Associate Dean, SA , and the list has been sent to his office for its
approval. I would like to congratulate all the identified candidates for
making it to the final list and advise them to start working towards their
respective responsibilities for betterment of the hostel. Moreover, as
conveyed during individual interactions, the council members need to help
in the smooth running of hostel affairs until the first few months of the
new academic year before a new council from the next batch is identified.

council shortly.

26/03/2025, 00:59 - Rohit Gupta W4 First Floor: Greetings from ICC!

The Institute Cultural Council is excited to invite applications for the post of Institute Cultural Club Conveners for various clubs under Culturals at IIT Bombay for the 2025-26 tenure.

We are seeking individuals who are passionate about culturals and dedicated to enhancing the clubs' activities.

 If you have an eye for the genre or a curiosity for organization, we encourage you to apply. To know more about the same, go through this: https://tinyurl.com/ICC-Conveners-Brochure

Note that there are no prerequisites to apply, and groundworks will be scheduled with the club seniors after the form deadline to inform you of the roles and responsibilities of an ICC convener.
 
The posts available are (subjective to each club):
1. UG Convener (minimum one semester completed)
2. PG Convener (minimum one semester completed)
3. Senior Convener (minimum three semesters completed)
 
To apply, fill out the application form: https://tinyurl.com/ICC-Conveners-2025-26
 
Our council comprises a number of clubs each representing different and distinct art forms spanning both performing and non-performing genres. These clubs organize events throughout the year, showcasing the diverse cultural talents of our students.
 
As a convener, you will work closely with a team to organize events that promote cultural diversity and inclusivity.
We eagerly anticipate welcoming you to our family and working together for mutual growth and success!

28/03/2025, 14:58 - Siddhant Joshi: Dear students,

Greetings from the Institute Hostel Affairs council !

This mail is regarding the timeline for the hostel vacation during summer breaks. As we are approaching the end of the current semester, we kindly request your cooperation and support in the preparation for the upcoming semester by shifting (or vacating, wherever required) the hostel rooms. Your timely assistance in this matter would be greatly appreciated and would contribute to the smooth transition for all the students. In this context, please go through the mail carefully:



HOSTEL VACATION: For EXISTING 1st and 2nd-year students, rooms must be vacated by May 8, 2025, and for 4th-year UG students as well as 5th-year UG Dual Degree students, rooms must be vacated by May 10, 2025.


HOSTEL RETENTION: For EXISTING 3rd-year UG students, a Google form will be circulated by your respective hall manager. Those who wish to stay on campus during that period must fill out the form, and charges will be applied as per standard institute norms.


The following sheet link contains the details of the date of vacating your hostel. Please refer to the Google sheet below as per your academic program:

Link to Google Sheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UvXXBjViAVnfN8N7x7TTTuN55KLXdgNEdudOnIPNNi4/edit?usp=sharing 



Important guidelines:



All students must strictly follow the timelines, as indicated in the Google sheet. While I am sure that, being the responsible part of the campus community, you all would adhere to the respective timelines, failure to do so will attract a monetary penalty of INR 5000. Furthermore, the hostel authorities, in the presence of security personnel, reserve the right to vacate the room without your consent in case the student(s) has not adhered to the timeline of shifting/vacating the room. In such a case, the hostel and/or institute authorities will not be responsible for students' belongings.
All students who are supposed to graduate or shift need to submit a room vacation form at their current hostels. Students who are shifting to the new hostel will not be given rooms until they present the vacation slip at the new hostel office. Please do not argue with the hall manager in case you find yourself in such a situation for any reason.
Students who are eligible to store their belongings in their hostel (as a transit/storage space) can take carton boxes from the hostel office. Please contact the hall manager of the concerned hostel for the same. You are advised to carry your valuables/electronic devices with you while vacating the hostel. DO NOT KEEP IT IN THE STOREROOM.
Efforts would be made to provide a vehicle (for instance, e-cart etc.) to facilitate the process of shifting from one (parent) hostel to another (destination).
Please strictly avoid sending emails regarding special permissions, relaxation etc. from the process that needs to be strictly followed. Such requests will not be entertained.


Room vacating/shifting is an important exercise that needs to be completed over a stipulated time as the hostel rooms are to be kept ready for the next set of students who will be occupying the hostel rooms vacated by you. This new set of students also includes the ones from your youngest generation i.e. new batch of UG/PG students who would be completely new to IITB campus and all the more anxious entering the campus with high hopes. It is our joint responsibility to present them with a pleasant and smooth entry into their hostel rooms, something that we all expect when we are in such a situation. This exercise of room vacating/shifting has been initiated well in advance to achieve these objectives and I am sure, together we can make it happen.



NOTE: Complete details regarding the shifting process for all students and the storerooms will be communicated soon.

Dear freshers,
Greetings from SMP

As the academic year comes to an end, we at the Student Mentor Programme (SMP) would like to take a moment to appreciate the efforts of your ISMP Mentors. We present to you the Gratitude Corner - an opportunity for you all to thank your mentors for their guidance and companionship.

Drop by our desk in your mess, write down a heartfelt note to your ISMP mentors, and let them know how much their support has meant to you. Jot down your favourite memories with them and let them know how their support has shaped your first year. A simple message goes a long way, and we'd love for you to be a part of this!

*Date & Time: 10th April, 8.00 PM - 10.00 PM*
*Venue: H1 and H16 mess*

Looking forward to seeing you all at the desk.

19/04/2025, 16:27 - +91 80186 61497: Dear Residents,

Under the sustainability initiative, we have been conducting an interesting live experiment at Hostel 1 for the last 2 weeks: Tracking daily electricity consumption of the hostel through the electricity meter. I have attached the graphical results with this mail (PFA).

Some interesting inferences:

1. Daily consumption of our hostel is ~75 kWh

2. The electricity consumption spikes on Mondays to ~133 kWh. Something interesting is happening on Mondays (let's find out?)

So, what now?

We have identified dryers as major drivers of the hostel's electricity consumption. The rated capacity of the Dryers is 1.8 kW. Conservative calculations suggest that eliminating the use of dryers is equivalent to planting 0.8 trees daily (detailed calculations attached).

We have understood that several rooms do not have functional clotheslines. Paradkar Sir will soon make them available to all rooms. Drying clothes in sunlight possesses additional benefits of hygiene, as exposure to sunlight kills skin infection-causing bacteria and fungus.

Thank You



--
All credit to our caretakers, Mr. Sanjay and Mr. Sanjay Mhaske, for meticulously collecting the data on a daily basis. Special thanks to our Hall manager, sir, General Secretary, and Warden sir for facilitating the process.

This issue has arisen because many new hostels are being introduced this year, and some existing ones will be demolished in the future. As a result, the policies need to be updated, and updating them requires multiple approvals.
Please manage for a few days. Sorry for the inconvenience caused.

03/05/2025, 17:08 - +91 63010 60674: Dear Hostel 16 Residents,

We're happy to announce that the Hostel 16 Council has arranged a luggage transportation facility to assist you in shifting your belongings to your parent hostel with ease.

The service will be available from May 3 to May 7, daily between 7:00 PM and 11:30 PM, and is being provided free of cost for all residents.

Process for Shifting:
Residents are requested to pack their cartons securely.

Bring your packed cartons to the area near B Wing, from where the transportation will be coordinated.

Try to come with your friends, so that tempos can be filled quickly and dispatched without delay. This will help make the process faster and more efficient for everyone.

Your cooperation is appreciated in making this process smooth.

For any further queries feel free to contact

12/05/2025, 08:34 - +91 63010 60674: Howdy Fellas!

The allocation for the much-awaited Summer of Science 2025 is finally here, bringing with it an abundance of excitement and anticipation. 

We are thrilled to have received an astronomical number of entries again this year, and we extend our heartfelt thanks to the ever-curious Insti Junta for their enthusiastic participation. 

After careful consideration, we have finalised the list of mentees and their mentors and we are excited to see them begin their scientific journey together. Please note that this allocation is final and no requests for reallocation will be considered.

Mentor contact details have been provided in the sheet itself, so all mentees are expected to find their name in the sheet (using 'Find' option or Ctrl+F) and contact their mentor at the earliest. It is the mentees' responsibility to reach out to the mentor and start planning the SoS. The allocation can be found here: 
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19g1GT0oWCzvnCkh-udlMDRJGZyYfAdfYeVMptjewxsg/edit?usp=sharing

Further details and regulations alongside the definitive timeline shall be shared shortly. 
As we kick off Summer of Science 2025, we wish all the participants a fantastic summer ahead filled with learning, exploration, and fun. Happy Summers!

22/05/2025, 14:18 - +91 94062 13933: Greetings!

As we prepare to transition to a new chapter, the Institute Cultural Council is pleased to announce the opening of applications for the position of Institute Cultural Club Conveners for the following:

Publicity Wing

The outreach of an event in the days leading up to its execution is one the most important phases. In this regard, the Publicity Wing of Culturals, IIT Bombay takes on the task of managing the online profile of the ICC, and ideating innovative ways to create media content for the events and publicize the events under ICC in the best possible manner.

Web Council

The Web Council of Culturals, IIT Bombay spearheads all technical needs of the council which is especially important in an online setting, including any new initiatives such as website revamps or app development for Culturals.

Kava - The Culinary Club

Kava, the Culinary Club at IIT Bombay, is where you can explore the joy of cooking as a hobby and a passion.
Our main aim is to help everyone who loves cooking to learn more and get better at it, while also having lots of fun and making great food memories.

IIT-Bombay Broadcasting Channel

The multimedia and journalism body of IIT Bombay, aims to give the viewers a sneak peek into the events, activities, and life at IIT Bombay. The channel has a wide variety of content, including but not limited to:
Reporting and covering important time-sensitive events on campus, interactive sessions/workshops, etc.
Special features on different activities/people on campus, and documentaries
Video articles and themed video series such as "Know your Professor", "Research Labs in the Institute" etc.

The conveners are expected to be enthusiastic to work for this culture and to promote it in the institute.

Interested candidates should fill this form (mandatory)
If you want to apply for more than one position, fill the form separately for each position.
 
https://forms.gle/xEpAFU3VXGNM7Cwi6

The deadline for filing the nominations is 11:59 PM, 26th May 2025 for all the clubs unless stated otherwise.

13/06/2025, 15:18 - Siddhant Joshi: Dear All,

This message is to inform you about the hostel room shifting and arrival
schedule for all existing students for the upcoming Autumn semester.

All UG students (excluding 2nd-year UG students, 24B..... batch) can
begin occupying their allotted rooms/hostels from 15th July, with the
shifting period scheduled from 15th to 21st July.

For UG 2nd-year students (24B..... batch), arrival on campus will begin
from 19th July, and the shifting should be completed by 25th July.

Except for MBA and MSc 2nd-year students, the remaining Master's/PhD
students should start shifting to their new rooms/hostels from 1st to
10th July. The allotment plan for Master's/PhD boys has already been
shared. Please note that students who were initially allotted Hostel 19
or Hostel 1 will now be shifted to Hostels 17 and 18, due to some
operational issues (ongoing construction activities and the immediate
unavailability of H19 and H4). The revised allotment plan will be shared
shortly as soon as these two new hostels are ready and become
operational.

MBA and MSc students can shift to their new hostels/rooms from 15th to
21st July.

UG 3rd-year boys (23B..... batch) will continue to stay in their current
hostels in shared occupancy.

The detailed allotment plan for UG final-year boys and girls and
Master's/PhD girls will be shared by 25th June 2025.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused. The institute has
been working hard and is making every possible efforts to make the new
hostel available for the students community. However, given the current
status on the readiness of H-19 and H-4, the above shared plan of hostel
accommodation would be executed at this point of time. Should the
construction work of these new hostels be completed earlier than
expected, further communication will be shared accordingly.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation

We‚Äôre excited to kick off Demystifying Interviews 4.0, our flagship interview prep series under the English Learning Program (ELP), with two online sessions this week focused on helping you ace every part of the interview process ‚Äî from communication to documentation.

Session 1: SoP Writing & Apping
Date: 28th June
Time: 1:00 PM (IST)

This session will cover how to write impactful Statements of Purpose (SoPs) and cover letters for university internships and research roles. You'll also learn to craft effective messages and emails for outreach, along with an overview of research programs that students can apply to based on their interests.

Date: 29th June

26/06/2025, 21:56 - Siddhant Joshi: Dear All,

With the (near) availability of Hostel-7/8/21, and through better room and hostel optimization -- along with continuous efforts from the Associate Dean (SA) and the Institute Hostel Affairs Council -- the following changes will be implemented starting this year:

1.UG 2nd and 3rd Year Boys:
As per the regular practice, shared accommodation will continue in Hostels 2, 3, and 5. However, those who were earlier supposed to stay in Hostels 6 and 9 this year will now be allotted shared rooms in Hostels 17 and 18 instead.

2.Final Year Master's Students (MSc/MTech/MDes/Others):
In previous years, due to resource constraints, final-year master's female students had to continue their stay in shared occupancy. From this year onwards, all final-year master's girls will be allotted single occupancy rooms.

3.Hostels 6 and 9 Converted to Single Occupancy:
Hostels 6 and 9 have now been converted to single occupancy rooms and will be allotted to incoming master's male students.

Hostel allotments for many students have already been updated on the ASC portal. For those whose allotment hasn't been reflected yet, it will be updated within a day or two.
Please check your hostel allotment by logging into the ASC portal.

Thank You.

-- 

Lead with Vision, Succeed with Precision

Regards,

07/07/2025, 12:23 - +91 95308 03153: Hello all,

The recent decision by the administration to take away the option of paying the SMA in two installments needs to be collectively resisted. The installment based SMA payment was brought in after a long protest by students in August 2022 against the fee hike. Since then, the administration has increased SMA once, and now they are taking away the installment option, too. This is a clear regressive step that shows blindness and neglect towards the needs of a diverse student community that comes to this public education  institution. 

If this decision goes unopposed, the administration will surely go one step ahead very soon, and we might expect a big fee hike in the recent future. 

 *We are starting a signature campaign that demands restoration of the installment based SMA payment.* Please do join this campaign if the concerns raised here resonate with you. 

We are also forming a WhatsApp group to further coordinate this effort.

 *To join the whatsapp group* : https://chat.whatsapp.com/B8QHJQUGPWpGkjiyCH9mpn?mode=r_t 

 *Kindly the sign following form:* https://forms.gle/3BajjxDqAfthfXUS6

11/07/2025, 18:51 - Siddhant Joshi: Hello Everyone,

I hope you're all doing well.

I'm writing to inform you about an important update regarding the SMA
payment.

Based on the feedback given on the difficulties students would face in
making full payment at once, the institute has decided to reinstate the
two installment system for payment of Semester Mess Advance (SMA).
Accordingly, the revised SMA payment schedule for the upcoming Autumn
semester ('25-26) is as follows:

* First installment to be deposited by 15th July 2025

  * Second installment to be deposited by 30th September 2025

On behalf of the Institute Hostel Affairs Council, I personally appeal
to the students community to take note of the support that we have
received from the institute in reinstating the two-instalments system
for SMA payment. While this arrangement does lead to additional
(hostel-level) administrative work (vis-a-vis single instalment system),
the institute has reinstated the two instalment system considering the
larger interests of the students. Please note that waiver or extension
requests will NOT be entertained after the above-mentioned deadlines.

15/07/2025, 10:05 - Siddhant Joshi: üî¥üî¥ Urgent üî¥üî¥
Dear All,

As per the directions of the Supreme Court each and every student of the
institute needs to submit the following declaration form pertaining to
ragging. This is part of compliance and all students (UGs and PGs) of the
institute MUST submit the same.

The form is available on the antiragging.in website. Direct links to fill
and download the filled form have been attached below.
Note: The total time it takes to fill the form is about 2-3 minutes.

--

Please follow the steps given below to complete the form.

Step 1: Click on the link given below.
https://www.antiragging.in/affidavit_university_form.php

Step 2 : Fill the form with your details, parents details, University and
course details.

Step 3: University/Institute information is given below:

State in which University is based : MAHARASHTRA (select in the drop-down)
University name: Indian Institute of Technology Mumbai (U-0306) - Make sure
you select this option from the drop-down menu.

Your University Details: Appear automatically.

Type the following details
University Director: Shireesh B. Kedare
University Phone Number: 225722545
Nearest Police Station: Powai

Step 4: Check on all the UGC regulations

Step 5: Fill up the survey

Antil ragging helpline number: 18001805522

Step 6: Submit form

--

Step 7: Note down the 8 digit reference number the page displays once you
submit the form.

Step 8: Download the undertaking document by clicking on the following link
using your credentials including the reference number.

https://www.antiragging.in/undertaking_request.php


Step 9: You need to upload this document (with signatures) along with the
reference number (Step 7) on the ASC portal to complete your registration.
Without the successful uploading of the undertaking document and the
reference number, you will NOT be allowed to register. The option to upload
will be opened soon, students are to keep the ref number and the document
with them.
